about_the_game:
The class 50 unit freight locomotives built from 1939 onwards with a leading running axle and five coupled axles are among the most successful designs of the Deutsche Reichsbahn. This series was procured as part of Germany's preparations for war. Until 1948, 3164 machines of the 80 km/h fast class 50 were built by almost all European locomotive factories - finally as the transitional war locomotive 50 ÜK.

It was operated with various trailing tenders that carried the operating supply of water and fuel. At the end of the steam locomotive era, it became a universal class which, thanks to its low axle load, could also be used on branch lines with a lighter superstructure. They thus replaced the class 58, 52 and 57 in freight traffic.

Since the branch line network did not have sufficient turntables everywhere for such long machines, the locomotives were designed for a speed of 80 km/h in both directions. A striking feature is therefore a protective wall with windows at the front of the tender (2'2' T 26). The engines could haul ore trains weighing up to 2,200 tonnes.
The limit load on the level was 2,900 tons, whereby such trains already had to be pushed. On gradients of 1:60, the machine could tow the limit load of 550 tonnes at 30 km/h. At the Deutsche Reichsbahn, 208 locomotives were converted to the 50.35 series.
Among other things, the locomotives received new, more powerful boilers with a mixing preheater. The reason for the conversion was that boilers made of non-ageing resistant steel St 47 had to be replaced anyway.
3DZUG has created the class 50.35 in this DLC.

This locomotive is included in the Pigtail Line DLC.

Features:

- BR 50.35 steam locomotive

- BR 50 tender

- animated drivers cabin

- realistic PBR model
detailed_description:
The class 50 unit freight locomotives built from 1939 onwards with a leading running axle and five coupled axles are among the most successful designs of the Deutsche Reichsbahn. This series was procured as part of Germany's preparations for war. Until 1948, 3164 machines of the 80 km/h fast class 50 were built by almost all European locomotive factories - finally as the transitional war locomotive 50 ÜK.

It was operated with various trailing tenders that carried the operating supply of water and fuel. At the end of the steam locomotive era, it became a universal class which, thanks to its low axle load, could also be used on branch lines with a lighter superstructure. They thus replaced the class 58, 52 and 57 in freight traffic.

Since the branch line network did not have sufficient turntables everywhere for such long machines, the locomotives were designed for a speed of 80 km/h in both directions. A striking feature is therefore a protective wall with windows at the front of the tender (2'2' T 26). The engines could haul ore trains weighing up to 2,200 tonnes.
The limit load on the level was 2,900 tons, whereby such trains already had to be pushed. On gradients of 1:60, the machine could tow the limit load of 550 tonnes at 30 km/h. At the Deutsche Reichsbahn, 208 locomotives were converted to the 50.35 series.
Among other things, the locomotives received new, more powerful boilers with a mixing preheater. The reason for the conversion was that boilers made of non-ageing resistant steel St 47 had to be replaced anyway.
3DZUG has created the class 50.35 in this DLC.

This locomotive is included in the Pigtail Line DLC.

Features:

- BR 50.35 steam locomotive

- BR 50 tender

- animated drivers cabin

- realistic PBR model

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 11.6
  • Processor: Intel i5 2Ghz
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon Pro 555 with 1GB VRAM supporting OpenGL 3.3
  • Storage: 350 MB available space

short_description: The Deutsche Reichsbahn's Class 50 is a German steam locomotive built in large numbers from 1939 onwards, and was among the most successful designs of the Deutsche Reichsbahn. This pack features the DB Class 50 steam loco & tender, and a detailed cab view!
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Russian, Czech, Dutch, Polish, Portuguese - Portugal, Simplified Chinese
